p: Multivariate Cox regression models confirmed that influenza A virus infection (hazard ratio [ HR] : 2.637, 95% CI: 1.134–6.131, P = 0.024), age ( HR: 1.055, 95% CI: 1.033–1.077, P < 0.001), cardiovascular disease ( HR: 7.683, 95% CI: 3.175–18.58, P < 0.001), smoking history ( HR: 3.137, 95% CI: 1.417–7.124, P < 0.001), lymphocytes < 0.8 × 10 9/L ( HR: 10.473, 95% CI: 5.033–21.792, P < 0.001), blood urea nitrogen (BUN) > 7 mmol/L ( HR: 3.170, 95% CI: 1.449–6.935, P = 0.004) and arterial pH < 7.35 ( HR: 3.037, 95% CI: 1.552–5.945, P = 0.001) were independent risk factors for 30-day mortality in Flu-p patients (Table 4).
